CatDescriptText: Alberta Tyson, laundry worker, Homewood and Patricia Avery, Homewood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 19, 1960, pg. C1 with question "Why do you think Negroes voted so heavily for Senator John F. Kennedy, Democrat, for President, in last Tuesday's election?"  Mrs. Tyson's answer reads: "I think they voted for him because he was the best man." Ms. Avery's answer reads: "I believe they voted for him, beaus they believed that he would do more for the colored people than Nixon would."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Alberta Tyson wearing patterned coat and scarf, standing on sidewalk in front of brick street, car, and house; Portrait of Patricia Avery wearing felted coat with dark collar, standing on sidewalk in front of brick street, car, and house
